page.title: 03Chalfont St.Peter Geography.
page.content: The {landscape} is dominated by a ridge of chalk that runs parallel with the {Misbourne} valley.The slope,rising from the valley floor and the A413,is now entirely built up with residential property.At the summit,marking the residential boundary,is Denham Lane. Beyond this,forming a plateau,is the {Green Belt} area which then falls away to the East.The section nearest Denham Lane is grazing land,beyond which is a line of dense Beechwood.This ground is mainly chalk with an overlying layer of clay,also pockets of gravel which are still being excavated.The eastern slope is put to agricultural use and has recently been crossed by the {M25}.The main crop is rapeseed.The two oldest roads crossing the area are Denham Lane and Rickmansworth Lane.Apart from a couple of farms and cottages,all other property has been added since 1940.
